required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Antibiotic Therapy for Early Onset Neonatal Sepsis
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of Antibiotics in the Treatment of Early Onset Neonatal Sepsis

collaborator.agency: Tianjin Central Hospital of Gynecology Obstetrics

brief_summary.textblock: Antibiotic therapy for early onset neonatal sepsis recommended by international guidelines and relevant studies is only kind of treatment regimen that penicillin G/ penicillin/ampicillin combined with gentamicin as the first-line treatment regimen. However, it is not applicable to the clinical practice in many countries and regions. We aim to study efficacy and safety of antibiotics in the treatment of early onset neonatal sepsis.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 72 hours after ending initial antibiotic therapy
primary_outcome.description: requiring additional courses of antibiotic therapy within 72 hours after ending initial antibiotic therapy and/or progression of the illness, necessitating a change of antibiotic and/or blood culture isolate reported resistant to the antibiotic.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 3 days
In the first month of patients' life
Through study completion, an average of 3 days
secondary_outcome.description: The time of free drug concentration exceeding the minimal inhibitory concentration (fT>MIC)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 3 days
Through study completion, an average of 3 days
Through study completion, an average of 3 days
In the first month of patients' life
secondary_outcome.description: Death in the first month of life

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 3 days
secondary_outcome.description: Drug-related adverse events and serious adverse events

intervention.intervention_name: Piperacillin and tazobactam, azlocillin, latamoxef, meropenem, vancomycin

study_pop.textblock: Neonates suffered from early onset neonatal sepsis

facility.name: Tianjin Central Hospital of Gynecology Obstetrics

responsible_party.investigator_title: Head of department of clinical pharmacy and pharmacology
